meanings.definition: The state of being decrepit or worn out.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitudes of the old house were evident in its creaking floors.
meanings.sent2: The decrepitudes of the bridge made it unsafe to cross.
meanings.sent3: Despite its decrepitudes, the antique clock still chimed every hour.
meanings.sent4: The decrepitudes of time had taken their toll on the once majestic castle.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitudes of neglect were visible in the overgrown garden.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being feeble or infirm.
meanings.sent1: Her decrepitudes prevented her from climbing stairs easily.
meanings.sent2: The decrepitudes of age were starting to show in his shaky hands.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's playful antics belied its decrepitudes.
meanings.sent4: The decrepitudes of the old chair were evident in its wobbly legs.
meanings.sent5: Despite her decrepitudes, she maintained a positive outlook on life.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming weak or deteriorated.
meanings.sent1: The decrepitudes of the building were a result of years of neglect.
meanings.sent2: The decrepitudes of the economy were felt by all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The decrepitudes of the plan became apparent as obstacles arose.
meanings.sent4: The decrepitudes of the relationship were too great to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The decrepitudes of the fabric were visible in its fraying edges.
